definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Fortunately, there are two bullet casings, know who took part in target practice.
sentences.chinese: 还好，有两个子弹壳，知道自己曾经参加过打靶。

sentences.english: Bullet casings cover entirely a street in Monrovia.
sentences.chinese: 在蒙罗维亚，子弹壳铺满了整个街区。

sentences.english: But they're not going to pick up shell casings or anything like that.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们肯定不会拾起弹壳之类的东西。

sentences.english: Al alloy 3004 is chosen to manufacture shell cases of hunting rifles as a substitute of copper.
sentences.chinese: 为了节约铜材，选用了3004铝合金制造猎枪弹壳。

sentences.english: The cluster shells were discovered in the area shot by the Cambodian side, " said Panitan Wattanayagorn, the government spokesman."
sentences.chinese: 我们在柬埔寨火力攻击的地区发现了集束炸弹的弹壳。

sentences.english: When the laser gun launches, has the simulation sound of gunfire and the vibration cartridge case landing.
sentences.chinese: 激光枪发射时，有模拟枪声及振动弹壳落地。

sentences.english: The catridge is ejected from the gun automatically.
sentences.chinese: 弹壳能自动从枪里弹出。

sentences.english: The cluster shells were discovered in the area shot by the Cambodian side," said Panitan Wattanayagorn, the government spokesman.
sentences.chinese: 我们在柬埔寨火力攻击的地区发现了集束炸弹的弹壳。

sentences.english: Another is that the cartridge cases are slightly fatter.
sentences.chinese: 另一个负面影响就是弹壳变得稍微丰满了一点。

sentences.english: We've just got shell casings from a pistol from the spot," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们从现场只搜集到几个手枪弹壳。

definition: rifling (helical grooves inside the barrel of a gun)
